DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to examine the effectiveness of ethyl-eicosapentanoic acid (ethyl-EPA), an omega-3 fatty acid, in treating depression.
DOC.brief_title: Ethyl Eicosapentanoic Acid (Ethyl-EPA) for Treating Major Depression
DOC.detailed_description: Evidence suggests that omega-3 fatty acids may help reduce symptoms of depression. This study will determine whether ethyl-EPA, an omega-3 fatty acid, can be used safely and effectively to treat major depression. Participants will be randomly assigned to receive either ethyl EPA-containing pills or placebo daily for 8 weeks. Each week, participants will be asked to complete questionnaires which will be used to assess the severity of their depression.
DOC.criteria: Major depressive disorder Serious comorbid psychiatric disorder Unstable medical illness Prior use of any omega3 fatty acid product
